text:
What fans feared actually came true, yet it left everyone in shock. According to a report in The Deadline, Matt Reeves' directorial The Batman will be released by Warner Bros on June 24, 2021, but Ben Affleck won’t be a part of it.
Twitter
After playing Dark Knight in DCEU films (DC Extended Universe) including Batman v. Superman: Dawn of Justice, Suicide Squad and Justice League, Ben Affleck is handing over the cape to the new Batman.
popsugar-assets.com
Ben Affleck had to step down from the role as the new Batman movie will be based on a younger Bruce Wayn. Speculations were rife about the same for a very long time, but the shattering news was announced yesterday evening itself by Ben Affleck himself.
Excited for #TheBatman in Summer 2021 and to see @MattReevesLA vision come to life. https://t.co/GNgyJroMIO — Ben Affleck (@BenAffleck) January 31, 2019
And fans are heartbroken.
You were the most comic book accurate Batman that has ever been brought to the screen. I'm so thankful that you told a redemptive story about Bruce Wayne in such a human way. Your portrayal reminds me that every fallen person (meaning, all of us) can be saved. pic.twitter.com/AlTFxRo5SA — Rebecca Johnson (@derbykid) January 31, 2019
Don't Miss 12.5 K SHARES 5.5 K SHARES 3.4 K SHARES 3.1 K SHARES 2.5 K SHARES
If this is your way of saying goodbye then I just want to say thank you for giving us such a beautiful performance in BVS. I had the privilege of meeting you and what I told you remains the same. You will always be my Batman. Your performance saved my life. I’m gonna miss u 💔 — mandy 🦇🖤 (@xbatflecksx) January 31, 2019
You are still the greatest Bruce Wayne/Batman of all time. You gave us an unforgettable performance. Thank you forever, Ben. We love you. 🦇 pic.twitter.com/bohPvO3XCN — Jesabel 🥀 (@JesabelRaay) January 31, 2019
Thank you @BenAffleck for all the blood sweat and tears you've given us Batman fans over last the few years. pic.twitter.com/ARgTUQPiAP — Willam Kelly (@WillamKelley) January 31, 2019
Thank you for being my Batman and my Bruce Wayne, Ben.
You embodied everything I wanted to see from Batman on the big screen.
It's sad to see you hang the cape, really sad, but I guess all good things must come to an end.
Thank you. pic.twitter.com/ObWgts51Eu — •BatMax🦇• #ReleaseTheSnyderCut (@SupesBatsy) January 31, 2019
Who will wear the iconic cape now remains to be seen.
